de.weltraumschaf.commons.shell

Class LiteralCommandMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.weltraumschaf.commons.shell.LiteralCommandMap

  • public abstract class LiteralCommandMap
extends Object
    Maps the literal string of an command to its enum type. This class is not thread safe!
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Sven Strittmatter

    • Field Summary

      Map the literal sub command string to corresponding type enum.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LiteralCommandMap

        public LiteralCommandMap(SubCommandType defaultSubCommand)
        Dedicated constructor.
        Parameters:
        defaultSubCommand - sub command used for commands w/o sub command, usually a NONE type, must not be null

    • Method Detail

      • isCommand

        public final boolean isCommand(Token token)
        Determines if the string literal value of the token is a main command.
        Parameters:
        token - token to check
        Returns:
        true if the token is a command else false

      • isCommand

        public final boolean isCommand(String token)
        Determines if the string literal value is a main command.
        Parameters:
        token - token string to check
        Returns:
        true if the token is a command else false

      • determineCommand

        public final MainCommandType determineCommand(Token t)
        Determines the appropriate main command type for given string token. Determining a non command token string will result in an exception.
        Parameters:
        t - token to check
        Returns:
        command main type // CHECKSTYLE:OFF
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if, token is not a main command // CHECKSTYLE:ON

      • isSubCommand

        public final boolean isSubCommand(Token token)
        Determines if the string literal value of the token is a sub command.
        Parameters:
        token - token to check
        Returns:
        true if the token is a sub command else false

      • isSubCommand

        public final boolean isSubCommand(String token)
        Determines if the string literal value is a sub command.
        Parameters:
        token - token string to check
        Returns:
        true if the token is a sub command else false

      • determineSubCommand

        public final SubCommandType determineSubCommand(Token t)
        Determines the appropriate sub command type for given string token. Determining a non sub command token string will result in an exception.
        Parameters:
        t - token to check
        Returns:
        command sub type // CHECKSTYLE:OFF
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if, token is not a sub command // CHECKSTYLE:ON

      • getDefaultSubCommand

        public final SubCommandType getDefaultSubCommand()
        Get the default sub command for commands w/o sub commands. Usually your sub command enum should specify a special type for a non sub command.
        Returns:
        the enum type of the "none" sub command

      • getMainCommandType

        protected abstract Class<? extends MainCommandType> getMainCommandType()
        Return here the enum type which declares your main commands.
        Returns:
        never null
